title: PAC-Based Formal Verification for Out-of-Distribution Data Detection. (arXiv:2304.01592v1 [cs.AI])
abstract: Cyber-physical systems (CPS) like autonomous vehicles, that utilize learning components, are often sensitive to noise and out-of-distribution (OOD) instances encountered during runtime. As such, safety critical tasks depend upon OOD detection subsystems in order to restore the CPS to a known state or interrupt execution to prevent safety from being compromised. However, it is difficult to guarantee the performance of OOD detectors as it is difficult to characterize the OOD aspect of an instance, especially in high-dimensional unstructured data.  To distinguish between OOD data and data known to the learning component through the training process, an emerging technique is to incorporate variational autoencoders (VAE) within systems and apply classification or anomaly detection techniques on their latent spaces. translated_title: 基于PAC的形式化验证用于识别离群数据检测
translated_abstract: 本文针对利用学习组件的计算机物理系统（CPS），如自动驾驶汽车，在运行时遇到的噪声和离群数据（OOD）提出一种基于变分自编码器的方法，以区分OOD数据和经过训练过程的数据。
tldr: 本文提出了一种基于变分自编码器的方法用于计算机物理系统中离群数据检测，以实现实时系统的减少计算需求和识别OOD数据的效果。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a PAC-based approach using variational autoencoders to detect out-of-distribution data in cyber-physical systems, which benefits real-time systems through decreased processing requirements and ensures OOD detection.
